story:
Update//11.19.2013

192. That is the amount of hours in 8 days. 8 days is how long it took to fully fund my campaign. 8 out of the 40 days I anxiously, nervously planned at the launch of this last Sunday.
I cannot believe it. It's funded! We did it! 
/WE/ DID IT!!!
I am so grateful and so absolutely stunned at the same time. You believe in my dreams, my goals, and aspirations. It's because of you that all of this can happen. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. I have had so much support in hearts and places. I had no idea. 

Please know that this campaign will run for another 30 days and is still able to be contributed to! If you would still like to contribute and share this campaign those efforts will go to a secondary goal of $2,200.
This amount will allow me to add 1-2 looks with higher quality fabrics and notions. Most importantly it will allow me to stay in Kansas City for a longer duration, allowing me to network with other designers, media, and potential employers.
This is wonderment and love. I am so stunned by this support and love you so so much. This is the beginning and this journey is going to last for a long long time.
xx
Stayce

The Aspiring Designer.


Stayce Petraborg, Emerging Apparel Designer

When I was younger I was always into performance, dance, and theater. I wasn’t the child that sewed her dance costumes or her prom dress in high school, but I was the girl that always wanted to stand out. I was a tinker and hodge podge crafter. I had a big imagination back then and I think that has fueled my drive and motivation now. I love to make my ideas real, no matter how complex and unachievable they seem. It wasn’t until I found costume design and the cosplaying community that I fell into stride with this exciting devotion to create and manipulate materials. 

I’m currently a student in my senior year, enrolled in the University of Minnesota’s Apparel Design program. I’m greatly influenced by science fiction genres and Japanese culture among other imaginative, ambitious works. I seek to create pieces that are bold and enticing. I have a dream to find a niche in film costume design and high couture fashion. I also travel bi-annually to local conventions with 4-7 costumes per convention. I have competed in costume competitions, focusing on workmanship, sewing, and hand detailing.

-

Stayce is a strong designer with abounding ideas and energy. She welcomes challenges, and embraces the opportunity to solve them through patterning, material selection, fit, and function.  
-Elizabeth Bye, Professor Department Head, University of Minnesota - College of Design

-

Stayce is an excellent designer whose ambition seems to know no bounds. She aims high and always achieves her goals, even if that means working without sleep for days on end. She's a hard worker and cares deeply about all the garments she makes and is fiercely loyal to the people who are involved with her life.  
-Maddy Grimmer, Colleague, BFA, University of Minnesota

The Hope.

When it comes to my future I want to study abroad, work with prestigious firms, and eventually explore the options of being a film costume designer or an haute couture designer. It takes hard work and determination to get to that place… but it all starts here and now. My dream starts with school, now, and I need your help completing this first chapter in my life. My senior project.

-

They say that time flies, but you never really know the truth in those words until you experience it. I was accepted to the University of Minnesota - College of Design close to four years ago in the spring of 2010. The apparel design program is a four year program and it is, without a doubt, the biggest commitment and most difficult thing I have done in my life. When I walked through these doors I wasn’t looking towards the end. I was looking toward the potential and skills I would learn along the way. Now I am nearing the end of my journey as an undergraduate apparel design student as I begin the construction of my senior line.

When it comes to designing I have always evoked a sense that the more substantial and stubborn my pieces are, the more power and strength they convey. I crave a reaction to my pieces and my aesthetics. I want to entice my audience, capture them in a thespian way, and move them, maybe even inspire them to feel the motivation and wonderment that I feel. When I create I give my whole self to it. When I am asked ‘What inspired you for this design?’ I never want to hesitate and try to remember what it was. Each piece is a part of me, a projection of who I am as an individual.

I am currently working on my senior line, which is equivalent to a senior thesis. The line is composed of five looks, 12 garments total. Each year the senior class puts on a student-run fashion show in February to showcase their creations and debut their lines to the public. This year there are twenty of us, one of the largest classes to graduate from the Apparel Design Program. 



A featured look from debut show at KCFW F/W 2013

Along with my senior fashion show, I want to return and bring this collection to Kansas City Fashion Week in March of 2014 in Kansas City, MO. The line will be expanded from 5 looks to 8-10 looks depending on materials and time allocated.

-

Today, a new revival is sweeping across Kansas City. Designers and Boutiques again populate the city, bringing a new age of Fashion into the heart of the Midwest. In a collaborative effort, designers, boutiques, photographers, models, stylists, and artists have come together to make Kansas City Fashion Week an event to be talked about and remembered...
-kcfashionweek.com


The Dream

This particular collection is a culmination of everything I have learned as a designer, a student, and an individual. It is a journey that the audience can experience and watch change before their own eyes.

Inspired by Aristotle's final causation theory, this collection will transform, shed, and build in an array of different silhouettes. The looks will begin in casual street wear and morph 'up' through business wear, formal wear, evening wear, and finally end at avant garde/artistic design. The final look will, in theory, be the 'final form' of the collection. This line will consist of artistic fashion pieces of a couture and avant garde style. 



'Iron Jaw' - Official Moodboard and inspiration of the senior line.



Preliminary sketch utilizing scales and volume for drama



Fun with test garments! A preview of an overbust jacket


Rewards & Perks

My hope is that your pledges will not only help me make my pieces but give me a chance at a dream I could have never imagined doing on my own. You would give me hope.

The funds of this campaign will cover both the materials needed to create my senior line, the entrance fee to Kansas City Fashion Week Fall/Winter 2014 Show, and travel expenses from Minneapolis to Kansas City, MO. Your pledges will mainly go to covering the cost of my materials to build my senior collection: fabrics, electronic components (Arduino programming, LEDs, Servo Motors, etc), scales (aluminum polished scales, steel chainmail rings), understructures, patternmaking supplies, notions and much more. Two dresses alone require over 50 ‘superbright’ LEDs, 2500 scales and rings, and 35 yards of fabric.



One of Kind Artisan Dichroic Glass Pendants


When I created this campaign I wanted to make it as broad in donating range as possible. I wanted to ensure that I needed everyone’s help and no one was exempt. I also wanted to give as much as I could to show my donators and supporter just how much their contribution means to me.

I made sure my pledges were very special. I want my contributors to feel like they are receiving a piece of my show and my project. Every bit counts from sharing this link or contributing a dollar all the way up to having a custom made jacket inspired by this collection. I have received the help of incredibly talented local artists that have been inspired by my line and donated hand-crafted, wearable pieces for this campaign, including beautiful handblown glass pendants and scale mail flowers that can be fashioned into brooches or hair clips. I am also crafting LED illuminated fascinators that can be fashioned into boutonnières.

I want my contributors to feel a part of this project and a part of this show. These pieces are meant to be worn and I would LOVE to see them worn at the show. These pieces will be delivery in January of 2014 just in time for the show!



Handmade Artisan Scale Flowers


Strength in Numbers

There is a saying that your friends are a family you get to choose. It's /almost/ correct. I didn't choose my friends, they found me and took a gander. They strengthen me, and fuel me every single day. This campaign is not a one person show and neither is my success as a designer. I am here because I have a drive and dream, but it is fueled with the love and support of the people I am so lucky to be surrounded by. 

This campaign never would have got off the ground if it wasn't for the chief editing skills of Katie Simning. I also want to send my thanks to Carr Hagermann for his ingenious ideas, collaboration, and ability to sift through my imagination.

The video is credited to the beautiful Angela Haugejorden and her really impressive patience. I don't remember the amount of hours she put into the video editing after shooting. I also want to thank her partner in crime, Matt Ferry, for his amazing sound editing skills.

To my incredible artisans, Christopher Poletto and Melissa Simmer, donating their time and talent to my campaign. I am truly blessed to be able to collaborate with you.

This is a journey and the people you meet along the way give you such a beautiful insight. I am surprised every moment and grateful for every friendship. Thank you so much for taking the time and, most notably, for believing in me.

For more of my team's talents and contacts:
Katie Simning | Twitter
Angela Haugejorden | Website
Matt Ferry | mfpercussion@gmail.com
Christopher Poletto | Facebook
Melissa Simmer | solana420@aol.com


Other ways to help

I know in some instances donating and pledging isn’t possible. I ensured I had every budget at heart to enlist the help of those who want to give, but there are other ways to help too!

Share this link with everyone you know; friends, family, and anyone you think would be interested in helping my cause. If this campaign is shared enough I may even get the chance to be showcased on indiegogo’s mainpage!

Being financially supported is an incredible honor, and being supported by word of mouth and having people know and enjoy my work is just as important!I want to thank you for your support and taking the time to read on my campaign. It doesn’t matter how much or how little you pledge, it all goes towards a dream I cannot wait to make true! And you’re helping me get there, bit by bit!


Sincerely, hopefully, & wistfully,
xx
Stayce Petraborg
Apparel Design Student
University of Minnesota – Twin Cities
story_txt:
Update//11.19.2013192. That is the amount of hours in 8 days. 8 days is how long it took to fully fund my campaign. 8 out of the 40 days I anxiously, nervously planned at the launch of this last Sunday.I cannot believe it. It's funded! We did it! /WE/ DID IT!!!I am so grateful and so absolutely stunned at the same time. You believe in my dreams, my goals, and aspirations. It's because of you that all of this can happen. Thank you from the bottom of my heart. I have had so much support in hearts and places. I had no idea. Please know that this campaign will run for another 30 days and is still able to be contributed to! If you would still like to contribute and share this campaign those efforts will go to a secondary goal of $2,200.
This amount will allow me to add 1-2 looks with higher quality fabrics and notions. Most importantly it will allow me to stay in Kansas City for a longer duration, allowing me to network with other designers, media, and potential employers.This is wonderment and love. I am so stunned by this support and love you so so much. This is the beginning and this journey is going to last for a long long time.xxStayceThe Aspiring
Designer.Stayce Petraborg, Emerging Apparel DesignerWhen I was younger I was always into performance, dance, and
theater. I wasn’t the child that sewed her dance costumes or her prom dress in
high school, but I was the girl that always wanted to stand out. I was a tinker
and hodge podge crafter. I had a big imagination back then and I think
that has fueled my drive and motivation now. I love to make my ideas real, no
matter how complex and unachievable they seem. It wasn’t until I found costume
design and the cosplaying community that I fell into stride with this exciting
devotion to create and manipulate materials. I’m currently a student in my senior year, enrolled in the
University of Minnesota’s Apparel Design program. I’m greatly influenced by
science fiction genres and Japanese culture among other imaginative, ambitious
works. I seek to create pieces that are bold and enticing. I have a dream to
find a niche in film costume design and high couture fashion. I also travel
bi-annually to local conventions with 4-7 costumes per convention. I have
competed in costume competitions, focusing on workmanship, sewing, and hand
detailing.-

Stayce is a strong designer with abounding ideas and
energy. She welcomes challenges, and embraces the opportunity to solve them
through patterning, material selection, fit, and function.  -Elizabeth Bye, Professor Department Head, University of
Minnesota - College of Design

-

Stayce is an excellent designer whose ambition seems
to know no bounds. She aims high and always achieves her goals, even if that means
working without sleep for days on end. She's a hard worker and cares deeply
about all the garments she makes and is fiercely loyal to the people who are
involved with her life.  -Maddy Grimmer, Colleague, BFA, University of Minnesota

The Hope.When it comes to my future I want to study abroad, work with
prestigious firms, and eventually explore the options of being a film costume
designer or an haute couture designer. It takes hard work and determination to
get to that place… but it all starts here and now. My dream starts with school,
now, and I need your help completing this first chapter in my life. My senior
project.-They say that time flies, but you never really know the
truth in those words until you experience it. I was accepted to the University
of Minnesota - College of Design close to four years ago in the spring of 2010. The apparel design program is a four year program and it is, without a doubt, the biggest commitment and most difficult thing I have done in my life. When I walked through these doors I wasn’t looking towards the end. I was
looking toward the potential and skills I would learn along the way. Now I am
nearing the end of my journey as an undergraduate apparel design student as I
begin the construction of my senior line.When it comes to designing I have always evoked a sense that
the more substantial and stubborn my pieces are, the more power and strength
they convey. I crave a reaction to my pieces and my aesthetics. I want to
entice my audience, capture them in a thespian way, and move them, maybe even
inspire them to feel the motivation and wonderment that I feel. When I create I
give my whole self to it. When I am asked ‘What inspired you for this design?’
I never want to hesitate and try to remember what it was. Each piece is a part
of me, a projection of who I am as an individual.I am currently working on my senior line, which is equivalent
to a senior thesis. The line is composed of five looks, 12 garments total. Each
year the senior class puts on a student-run fashion show in February to showcase their creations and debut their lines to the public. This year there are twenty of us, one of the largest classes to graduate from the Apparel Design Program. A featured look from debut show at KCFW F/W 2013Along with my senior fashion show, I want to return and bring this
collection to Kansas City Fashion Week in March of 2014 in Kansas City, MO. The
line will be expanded from 5 looks to 8-10 looks depending on materials and
time allocated.-

Today, a new revival is sweeping across Kansas City. Designers and Boutiques again populate the city, bringing a new age of Fashion
into the heart of the Midwest. In a collaborative effort, designers, boutiques,
photographers, models, stylists, and artists have come together to make Kansas
City Fashion Week an event to be talked about and remembered... -kcfashionweek.com

The DreamThis particular collection is a culmination of everything I
have learned as a designer, a student, and an individual. It is a journey that
the audience can experience and watch change before their own eyes.Inspired by Aristotle's final causation theory, this collection
will transform, shed, and build in an array of different silhouettes. The looks
will begin in casual street wear and morph 'up' through business wear, formal
wear, evening wear, and finally end at avant garde/artistic design. The
final look will, in theory, be the 'final form' of the collection. This line
will consist of artistic fashion pieces of a couture and avant garde style. 
'Iron Jaw' - Official Moodboard and inspiration of the senior line.
Preliminary sketch utilizing scales and volume for drama
Fun with test garments! A preview of an overbust jacket
Rewards & PerksMy hope is that your pledges will not only help me make my
pieces but give me a chance at a dream I could have never imagined doing on my
own. You would give me hope.The funds of this campaign will cover both the materials
needed to create my senior line, the entrance fee to Kansas City Fashion Week
Fall/Winter 2014 Show, and travel expenses from Minneapolis to Kansas City, MO.
Your pledges will mainly go to covering the cost of my materials to build my
senior collection: fabrics, electronic components (Arduino programming, LEDs,
Servo Motors, etc), scales (aluminum polished scales, steel chainmail rings),
understructures, patternmaking supplies, notions and much more. Two dresses
alone require over 50 ‘superbright’ LEDs, 2500 scales and rings, and 35 yards
of fabric.One of Kind Artisan Dichroic Glass PendantsWhen I created this campaign I wanted to make it as broad in
donating range as possible. I wanted to ensure that I needed everyone’s help
and no one was exempt. I also wanted to give as much as I could to show my
donators and supporter just how much their contribution means to me.I made sure my pledges were very special. I want my
contributors to feel like they are receiving a piece of my show and my project.
Every bit counts from sharing this link or contributing a dollar all the way up
to having a custom made jacket inspired by this collection. I have received the
help of incredibly talented local artists that have been inspired by my line
and donated hand-crafted, wearable pieces for this campaign, including beautiful handblown glass pendants and scale
mail flowers that can be fashioned into brooches or hair clips. I am also
crafting LED illuminated fascinators that can be fashioned into boutonnières.I want my contributors to feel a part of this project and a
part of this show. These pieces are meant to be worn and I would LOVE to see
them worn at the show. These pieces will be delivery in January of 2014 just in
time for the show!Handmade Artisan Scale FlowersStrength in NumbersThere is a saying that your friends are a family you get to choose. It's /almost/ correct. I didn't choose my friends, they found me and took a gander. They strengthen me, and fuel me every single day. This campaign is not a one person show and neither is my success as a designer. I am here because I have a drive and dream, but it is fueled with the love and support of the people I am so lucky to be surrounded by. This campaign never would have got off the ground if it wasn't for the chief editing skills of Katie Simning. I also want to send my thanks to Carr Hagermann for his ingenious ideas, collaboration, and ability to sift through my imagination.The video is credited to the beautiful Angela Haugejorden and her really impressive patience. I don't remember the amount of hours she put into the video editing after shooting. I also want to thank her partner in crime, Matt Ferry, for his amazing sound editing skills.To my incredible artisans, Christopher Poletto and Melissa Simmer, donating their time and talent to my campaign. I am truly blessed to be able to collaborate with you.This is a journey and the people you meet along the way give you such a beautiful insight. I am surprised every moment and grateful for every friendship. Thank you so much for taking the time and, most notably, for believing in me.For more of my team's talents and contacts:Katie Simning | TwitterAngela Haugejorden | WebsiteMatt Ferry | mfpercussion@gmail.comChristopher Poletto | FacebookMelissa Simmer | solana420@aol.comOther ways to helpI know in some instances donating and pledging isn’t
possible. I ensured I had every budget at heart to enlist the help of those who
want to give, but there are other ways to help too!Share this link with everyone you know; friends, family, and
anyone you think would be interested in helping my cause. If this campaign is
shared enough I may even get the chance to be showcased on indiegogo’s
mainpage!Being financially supported is an incredible honor, and
being supported by word of mouth and having people know and enjoy my work is
just as important!I want to thank you for your support and taking the time to
read on my campaign. It doesn’t matter how much or how little you pledge, it
all goes towards a dream I cannot wait to make true! And you’re helping me get
there, bit by bit!Sincerely, hopefully, & wistfully,xxStayce PetraborgApparel Design StudentUniversity of Minnesota – Twin Cities

story:
Why a magazine?

Living and working in New York, we have met so many talented people. Designers, photographers, hair/make up/nail artists, musicians, painters, installation artists - without an agent or representation, the large pool of creatives is at times overwhelming and discouraging.

We want to create a new place to recognize emerging talent and provide opportunities for collaboration.  We'll help them to expand their network, while the audience is introduce to the artists and designers. 

Why a store?

The photo editorials will feature the contents of the store, and what better way to shop than seeing the pieces styled by some of New York's best! 

Our editors will be curating vintage clothing, and at times reworking it to make it not only unique, but wearable.  

Working with independent designers, we know how difficult it can be to get started.  We will be creating an online store that supports their product and treats them fairly.  

What's the money going to?

The more money we raise, the more people we'll be able to work with, creating jobs for freelancers.  Once the site is up and running, the money from the store will allow us to place orders with more independent designers! 

  • website design (if we exceed our goal, we will be able to outsource the project to a New York based freelance designer)
  • start-up costs  
  • p.r. and marketing
  • merchandising 

How did we choose our perks?

The core perks offered are being provided by independent business we have worked with closely and formed strong bonds because of the experience.

We will be adding more along the way, so check back often!

When is it launching?

Early fall of 2013. 

What's the name?

We're still working the legalities of this out, we'll let you know as soon as we do!

story:
Short Summary

Help our team reach our goal to clothe 50K people with a message about Christ. Join the mission!!

In the Gospels, Jesus commanded us to make more disciples. But in today’s world with busy schedules and communication mostly via technology, face to face evangelism can be quite a challenge.

Wear our t-shirts to help reach the world with the salvation message. Each of our t-shirts offer a simple and clear point. With strong graphics and powerful images, the words of Christ are illustrated and brought to life. Designed for the active Christian, our t-shirts include sports themes such as football, basketball, fishing, dance and volleyball.

These t-shirts are ideal for school and church teams, but provide all believers with an easy way to share their faith.


What We Need & What You Get

We are raising monies to print 1500 T-Shirts to sell and donate. We are targeting young athletes first, through sports tournaments and youth organizations. Our mission is to clothe 50k people in 36 months. Our initial printing of 1500 shirts will allow us to raise enough funds to attend our first 3 events and one convention. This will also allow us to build our online and social media presence, which serves as a main form of communication to our youth. We are passionate to spread the word of Christ, especially to our youth and young athletes. Please help us! No donation too small.

The Impact

1. If we do not get 100% funded, we will not be successful in our goal
2. This is the first line of its kind and it is important that we start strong in our ministry and mission.  
3. Young people place a lot of emphasis on specific major brands to identify themselves with. This is why we want to make it simple to stand up and represent Christ in a time where importance has been placed on worldly things.

Help us to bring back a focus and an importance on Christ. We are asking for your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out about our website at www.c-lineapparel.com

Use the Indiegogo share tools and spead the word about our campaign

Contribute $1 and ask 2 people to do the same!

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
ME


My name is Patrick Durosier and I own a design firm in Montreal. After a few years in the business I've decided to follow my heart and to start something that matters.

As an entrepreneur I love surpassing myself and conquering life's many challenges. I also love discovering business opportunities and helping others in return.

What is a Harlequin? 

A Harlequin was a 16th-century pantomime character or jester who wore a robe made of a patchwork of coloured fabric.

What is Harlequin Blazer?

We're allowing the menswear market to gain creative control. Harlequin is a line of blazers with a feature that allows customers to personalize their orders.

Our mission at Harlequin is improving the image of a new generation of consumers through our blazers. Our designs go from classic blazers to more fashion forward pieces, with the option to personalize. The Harlequin blazer will give the customer the freedom to customize a garment that fit their own image, at a faire price.


Your Blazers

High quality products, originality are our goals. Harlequin will be available across North America. Harlequin wants to focus on the sense of belonging and uniqueness of your the blazer.


(These are not real samples. They are used has an exemple only*)

Production

Our goal is producing the blazer and jacket In Haïti. Why?

A - Because it's my country of origin

B - Bring the production closer to US soil thus improving quality control and production

C - I want to help Haïti by creating job opportunities and helping the economy. 

Reading the book from the Chief Shoe Giver aka CEO of Toms shoes sparked something in me. I truly wanna start something that matters.

The country minimum wage is $5US a day and to be frank thats unacceptable to me. By producing in Haïti, I want to give more than the minimum wage required and allow the people of Haïti better opportunities. 


Social Economic Impact 

Having a social impact is mandatory for this project. There's a great need for financial, educational and social support. Our objective is providing kids with school uniform and school material with every blazer sold.   


Funding Objectives

  • Help us get our start-up inventory 
  • Help us get the production equipment
  • Hiring the personnel


Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Spread the word 
  2. Get Oprah, Ellen or Obama to hear about my project
  3. Use the Indiegogo share tools. It really makes a difference!
  4. Pray for the campaign to work....


Risks And Challenges

Shipping: A great concern for us is having a great delivery turnaround. We've made sure of partnering with the right shipping company to have the most efficient delivery system. Our blazers and jackets are produced within 4 days of ordering.

Quality & Control: Our blazers are all produced in Haïti. We decided to avoid assembling and producing our blazers and jackets outside of America.


Perks

See Next !!!!


For any questions

Contact us at 514 664 4723 or patrick@beharlequin.com

story:
After raising over $11k with our Silver Diamond Kickstarter, many of you asked for a smaller version.

Introducing the MINI Silver diamond!  The same asymmetrical polyhedron shape you love in a smaller size. Perfect for more casual settings and for children. Comes with the popular solid silver chain for free!

The Eternal Diamond

The symbol of eternal love, captured in solid sterling silver. We've created a timeless work of art we call the Silver Diamond. Every angle illuminates with brilliance with each handmade piece.

The Silver Diamond is a 3 dimensional mathematical construct called an asymmetrical polyhedron. After days of CAD work (see below) we felt this was the perfect shape to combine elegance and uniqueness.

Each Silver diamond is solid Sterling silver with a perfect mirror finish. Included is a solid Sterling Silver chain.

Pure Sterling Silver

We used a solid Silver design meant to last a lifetime. The Silver Diamond is treated to resist tarnishing. The pure solid silver pendant will stay bright and shiny for years to come without any cleaning!

It's a stunning piece of jewelry

Enjoy the brilliance from any angle.

Secure and solid design. The necklace becomes part of the pendant.A unique flow-through design allows the necklace to become part of the design without disturbing the lines of the pendant.

The front and back are symmetrical and can be worn on either side with the same effect.

the special  joint design combined the necklace with pendant  perfectly

The development of  an asymmetrical polyhedron is much more difficult than imagined. We used the power of CAD design to work out the details before making our first prototype. Designing jewelry this way results in an amazingly accurate, stunning piece.

 

SPECIFICATIONS

The MINI (left) compared in size to the original Silver Diamond (right)

MINI Silver Diamond Necklace：                                               

Pendant: 100% solid sterling silver

Size: 17.7mm x 13.7mm x 6.8mm     Weight:  6 grams

Necklace: sterling silver     Length: 45cm                                                                              

Silver Diamond Necklace：

Pendant: 100% solid sterling silver

Size: 26mm x 20mm x 10mm     Weight: 21 grams

Necklace:sterling silver     Length: 45cm

 

Pledge today to make the MINI Silver Diamond a reality！

story:
Purchase Wallet TrackR Today!

http://www.wallettrackr.com


 

What is a Wallet TrackR?

The Wallet TrackR fits easily into any wallet - just like a credit card. When combined with the free Wallet TrackR iPhone app, it becomes a powerful new tool to keep you from losing your wallet. When the Wallet TrackR gets separated from your iPhone or iPad, the Wallet TrackR app gently alerts you that you may be leaving your wallet behind.

The app also takes a GPS snapshot of where your wallet was at the moment of separation in case you didn't hear the alert. Tap a button within the app to make your wallet "ring" in case your looking for it around the house or in the dark. The technology works both ways, which means your wallet can beep to alert you that you're leaving your phone behind. Works with your iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, new iPad, iPad mini and the new iPod Touch.

 

 

How does Wallet TrackR work?

Forget-me-not reminder

If you forget your wallet, the App will play your favorite song and the Wallet TrackR will beep before you get too far.

Lost and Found Map

The App remembers the location and time you separated from your Wallet TrackR and can show you on a map.

Is your wallet hiding?

If you cannot find your wallet, press the FIND button in the App to cause the wallet to beep.

Device Specs

Width: 4.1cm

Length: 6.8cm

Thickness: 3.8mm

Battery Life: 1.5 years

Device Compatibility: iPhone 4s & later, iPad 3rd Generation & later, and Android 4.4 devices with Bluetooth Low Energy.

 

 

What People are Saying

  "it could be its handiest device yet"

 

"the next great way to safeguard your wallet"

 

"I am really excited about this, not only because of the technology, but because of the affordability. It's a small price to pay to keep track of your valuable gear."

"that the darn thing actually fits inside of your wallet without creating a bulge"

 

 "Handy, eh?"

 

The Item TrackR App

The App is already available for download.  Try out the Item TrackR App for yourself today by using it to track your Bluetooth Headset or Car.


The App has an iPhone and iPad Interface.  The App can keep track of 10 items simultaneously.  In fact, the iPad has a special screen for you to interact with all your items on a single screen.

From the app you can set a custom icon, ring the device, see on a map where you last left your item (or where you parked your car if that is what you are tracking).  You can also be alerted with a custom ring tone.  

The separation alarm enables you to be reminded that you are leaving your item (or phone) behind with a brief chime.  

The app also has an Anti Theft Mode which will cause the wallet trackr to continuously ring if your wallet gets stolen.  It's a modern day car alarm.  You can silence the alarm with a single touch within the app.

With the app design, we tried to simplify the entire UI and enable users to access core functions as quickly as possible.  If you have any feature requests or feedback, we would love to hear it.  info@phonehalo.com or chris (at) phonehalo.com

 

 

 

 

What Things Can I Track?

Find those keys underneath the couch!

Be reminded when leaving for work without your laptop bag

"Who keeps forgetting which beer is theirs?!?"

"Not Us...Bro."

 

Our Inspiration

THE WALLET TRACKR STORY:

My roommate always misplaced his wallet and it caused him to run late. At that moment, I realized he wasn't the only one with this problem. I called Chris, and my friend from college, to brainstorm on solutions to this problem. Our goal was a simple and seamless solution to prevent the problem of misplacing their wallets. Wallet TrackR was designed to be the thinnest solution possible Most people place their wallet in their back pocket, so the design is sturdy enough to sit on.

The Creators

CHRIS HERBERT

Chris is a proud geek and lover of all things electronics and gadgets. Chris studied electircal engineering at University of Califronia Santa Barbara where he met Christian. After graduating, Chris started making consumer electronics devices and mobile applications. The projects chris has been involved with have won awards from Popular Mechanics, CES, and more.  Chris is an avid surfer and kite surfer.

 

chris (at) phonehalo.com

CHRISTIAN SMITH

Christian Smith is a mechanical engineer by training and enjoys imagining and creating new products. While attending the University of California, Santa Barbara, Christian and Chris were engineering classmates and surfed Campus Point in their spare time. After UCSB, Christian entered the world of manufacturing by building production robots and overseeing electronics production. When Christian is not building or playing with technology, he enjoys surfing, fishing, backpacking and playing his favorite instrument, the piano.

christian (at) phonehalo.com

 


The Timeline

Here is an estimated timeline for our project:

February 25, 2013:
Tooling complete
February 25 - February 28, 2013:
Production Pilot Run and testing
March 20 to April 20, 2013:
Production Run
April 30, 2013:
Delivery to customers

Frequently Asked Questions

  • Does the Wallet TrackR/TrackR Card work with my phone?

    The Wallet TrackR/Device works with iPhone 4s & later, iPad 3rd Generation & later, and Android 4.4 devices with Bluetooth Low Energy.

  • Is the App free?

    Yes, you can download a beta version here today!  The app can track your bluetooth headset or track where you park your car (Automatically in the background!)

  • How long will the batteries last on the TrackR Card?

    Since we are using the new Bluetooth Low Energy technology, the batteries will last approximately 2 years

  • What is the range of the Wallet TrackR?

    The Wallet TrackR can connect to your phone from as far away as 100 feet. The user can set the alert distance to 100 feet or less.

  • Can I track other valuables with the wallet TrackR?

    Yes. You can attach the Wallet TrackR to whatever you would like to track. Purses, laptop bags, luggage, backpacks are just a few ideas.

Questions? Comments?

Email me: chris (at) phonehalo.com

Press Page: http://phonehalo.com/presskit/
story_txt:
Purchase Wallet TrackR Today!
http://www.wallettrackr.com

 
What is a Wallet TrackR?
The Wallet TrackR fits easily into any wallet - just like a credit card. When combined with the free Wallet TrackR iPhone app, it becomes a powerful new tool to keep you from losing your wallet. When the Wallet TrackR gets separated from your iPhone or iPad, the Wallet TrackR app gently alerts you that you may be leaving your wallet behind.



The app also takes a GPS snapshot of where your wallet was at the moment of separation in case you didn't hear the alert. Tap a button within the app to make your wallet "ring" in case your looking for it around the house or in the dark. The technology works both ways, which means your wallet can beep to alert you that you're leaving your phone behind. Works with your iPhone 4S, iPhone 5, new iPad, iPad mini and the new iPod Touch.
 
 
How does Wallet TrackR work?

Forget-me-not reminder
If you forget your wallet, the App will play your favorite song and the Wallet TrackR will beep before you get too far.

Lost and Found Map
The App remembers the location and time you separated from your Wallet TrackR and can show you on a map.

Is your wallet hiding?
If you cannot find your wallet, press the FIND button in the App to cause the wallet to beep.

Device Specs
Width: 4.1cm
Length: 6.8cm
Thickness: 3.8mm
Battery Life: 1.5 years
Device Compatibility: iPhone 4s & later, iPad 3rd Generation & later, and Android 4.4 devices with Bluetooth Low Energy.
 
 


What People are Saying

"the next great way to safeguard your wallet"

story:
Now in its 4th year, the Fashion Law Institute’s unique annual summer intensive program, fondly known as Fashion Law Bootcamp, has been a phenomenal success. Designers, fashion industry executives, lawyers, students, and others in the U.S. and abroad have joined us to expand their knowledge of the law and business of fashion. Our Bootcampers have come from fashion houses as famous as Marc Jacobs and from every continent except Antarctica. However, every year there are great people who are admitted but cannot attend – and that's where you can help!

Send a designer to Fashion Law Bootcamp!

This campaign will cover the tuition for one designer (or more!) who would like to learn more about the business and legal side of fashion by attending Fashion Law Bootcamp. In classes with the Fashion Law Institute's founder, Professor Susan Scafidi, and illustrious guest instructors from throughout the industry, the recipient of this scholarship will gain a working knowledge of such important topics as

  • Fashion design protection,
  • Local manufacturing,
  • Fashion financing,
  • International trade,
  • Employment issues from designers to models,
  • Green fashion,
  • And much, much more!

Swag for you

In addition to the good feelings that come with making Fashion Law Bootcamp possible for a designer in need, contributors will receive official Fashion Law Institute merchandise, most of which has only been available to speakers or Bootcamp attendees.

Donors who cover at least the cost of a single tuition will also receive a range of sponsorship benefits, including a featured spot on the Fashion Law Institute's website and in media communications.

Too much success?

If you help us exceed our goal and support more than one scholarship, we’ll offer additional assistance to fashion designers, their full-time employees, or others in need. Every dollar you contribute will go to a full or partial scholarship to Fashion Law Bootcamp. Your contributions are tax-deductible - less the value of the perks, of course, which will be noted in our acknowledgement letter for your thoughtful gift!

For more about Fashion Law Bootcamp, check out our website!

The Fashion Law Institute is the world’s first center dedicated to law and the business of fashion. A nonprofit organization created with the generous support and advice of the Council of Fashion Designers of America and its president, Diane von Furstenberg, and based at Fordham Law School, the Institute offers training for the fashion lawyers and designers of the future, provides legal services for design students and professionals, and shares information and assistance on issues facing the fashion industry. Professor Susan Scafidi, who pioneered the field of fashion law, founded the Institute and serves as its academic director.

story:
Be free and be yourself, with BEFLAMBOYANT you can feel confident about expressing your own style, vibe and personality without compromising your commitment to animals and the environment. 

We have created unisex sneakers based on a few very simple principles: they should be vegan, sustainable, comfortable, and economical. We have a color for everyone and every situation.

We’re tired of being told what to wear; you should feel free to wear whatever you like. All our models are designed for everyone, for all those who feel identified with them, whether you’re a man or a woman.

 

Our first sneakers model is the UX68. We named them after the number of our return flight from the trip where we were inspired with the idea, which we will always remember.

 

When we found out that millions of animals are used by the fashion industry every year, we had just one goal in mind: to create cruelty-free fashion.

At BEFLAMBOYANT we feel a strong commitment to be another voice for change in the fashion industry. 

These days, we can buy all kind of things without thinking about what materials they are made of or if they might be harmful due to their materials or how they are produced. It’s very important to pay attention to what we are buying in the fashion industry because these materials will be in frequent contact with our skin. That’s why we have chosen our materials carefully for you. 

For us, transparency is fundamental. That’s why we want to tell you all about ourselves. 

The upper and lining are made of high-quality OEKO TEX and V LABEL certified microfiber.   

The inner lining is produced with zero CO2 emissions and free from chromium VI, a commonly-used chemical in the footwear industry that is considered a carcinogen and can be harmful to the skin. 

The shoe laces are 100% cotton, phthalates-free (a chemical found in many clothing items).

The sides are 50% recycled cotton, 25% virgin, and 25% organic, Global Recycled Standard “GRS” certified. 

The removable insole is 100% recycled PU and the sole is thermoplastic rubber, a 100% recyclable material.

 

 

 

The planet is close to reaching the point of no return. Several countries have declared an environmental state of emergency. It is time to take action.

To contribute to the fight against this disaster, we collaborate with the organization One Tree Planted to reforest areas destroyed by the wildfires in California, which has been ravaged by fire over the past few years.

Together, we will plant a tree for each pair of shoes sold. We will plant them in the areas most affected by the wildfires, where they are truly needed to return the area to its former splendor. 

To make this possible we have created the BEFLAMBOYANT project on their website.

For each pair of sneakers sold, we will add money to our project. When OneTreePlanted goes out on one of their periodic tree planting trips to California, we will donate the accumulated funds, one tree for each pair of sneakers.

You can visit our project here. In addition to buying our sneakers, feel free to donate a little extra to our project directly via the link.

 

We are all now aware of the current world-wide plastic problem. We want to help reduce the senseless spread of plastic by embracing a zero-waste philosophy. You won’t have to throw anything in the trash! 

We send your sneakers in a natural jute bag which can be re-used every day, together with a plantable seed thank you card so you can create new life thanks to your purchase. To keep your BEFLAMBOYANTs from being damaged during transport, all of this arrives in a cardboard box which you can reuse or recycle in any paper or cardboard receptacle.

No more plastic!

 

Your BEFLAMBOYANTs are made in Felgueiras, Portugal, a small town in the Northern part of Portugal whose main industry is footwear.

After a thorough search we found a factory motivated to be a part of our project, with excellent artisans with many years of experience working under fair labor conditions and following high manufacturing standards, we have been able to verify all this on our visits.

Thank you Sara, thank you Jovan Shoes. 

 

 

 

Composition: 100% cotton, plain knit, 165 g/m2 

According to the law, it may be a variation of a +/- 5% in the size of the garment.*

 

This project has taken over our lives for almost a year. It has been a difficult road, finding partners who share our values, goals, and who want to take a chance on us. Many thanks to all of them.

 

Special thanks to our friends:

 

 

From the BEFLAMBOYANT team, we invite you to be the best version of yourself.

Join us! Be a part of the change! 

BEFREE

BEYOURSELF

BEFLAMBOYANT

For more information, contact us by mail: info@beflamboyant.com

 

Risks & Challenges

We’ve faced many challenges this year. We have risked our savings to get here, in addition to investing a huge amount of our free time outside our normal jobs. Finding a factory that would take a chance on our project was the first challenge. Choosing high-quality materials that matched our brand’s values and creating an eye-catching image to identify us were also challenges that we have successfully overcome. 
In regards to the future, we plan to launch a new sneaker collection, create a line of unisex clothing, and, last but not least, be a new voice in the fashion industry that will reach many people and help them to be more aware of the problems of pollution, climate change, and animal cruelty in the fashion.

story:
• 50 voices were ordered during the Active Indiegogo campaign including our seven early access VocaliD Trailblazers. 
  • We're making another 50 voices available for pre-order now, during the InDemand phase of the campaign.


Each one of us has a unique voiceprint. Yet, until now, millions of people who rely on computerized speech to communicate have been given uniform voices. Voices that don’t fit their bodies or their personalities. We wouldn’t dream of fitting a little girl with the prosthetic limb of a grown man, so, why then the same prosthetic voice?

Tens of millions worldwide rely on a limited set of generic, synthetic voices. Their vocal ability may have been limited due to autism, cerebral palsy, genetic conditions, stroke, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), brain injury, or head and/or neck cancer. Whatever the cause, they share the desire to work, play, learn, and build relationships speaking as themselves, through their own voice.

Thanks to our successful IndieGoGo campaign we will be creating 7 Trailblazer voices in 2015.  Your contributions while In Demand bring VocaliD™ voices to market by late 2016.

Through years of research we observed that even those who have severe speech impairment produce distinctive sounds when they laugh, cry, and vocalize emotions and intentions. Their vocalizations contain the voice’s source -- its pitch, tone, rhythm, and loudness. What these individuals lack is the ability to manipulate their tongue, lips, and the shape of their mouth -- their vocal filter. The filter is essential to producing clearly articulated speech. So we developed technology to harness the source characteristics of recipients and supplement them with the vocal filters available to healthy talkers. The result is a blended voice that is as understandable as the donor while conveying the vocal identity of the recipient.


In other words, even a single vowel contains enough "vocal DNA" to seed the personalization process. VocaliD's custom voices are not mere replicas of the recorded samples. They are original creations that fit and honor the recipient -- bringing attention to her words and her voice.



Every contribution moves us closer to our goal of bringing VocaliD™ voices to market by 2016. We'll thank you with a great perk!



Listen to the stories of our beta users. Hear them speak -- through their own voices -- about the difference that VocaliD technology makes in their lives.  


It is not only recipients who feel the impact of a VocaliD™ voice. Family, friends, teachers, colleagues, and caregivers all benefit: 

  • a special education teacher can now differentiate among her students -- not only by their words but also through their voices;
  • parents delight in hearing their child speak for the first time in a voice they recognize as their child’s own; 
  • a teenager is empowered to build friendships and engage independently when friends, teachers, and coaches hear her as herself; 
  • a job candidate speaking through his own voice connects more easily with a potential employer, helping defy the odds for unemployment among those with disabilities.


VocaliD's technology can also be used to preserve and reconstruct a voice when needed. Think of it as insurance against a day when a voice is lost or unavailable for whatever reason. Perhaps a teacher suffering from throat cancer, a lawyer who is losing his voice to ALS, or even a young father, deployed overseas, who would love to read his two year old his newest bedtime story in his own voice.

Whether you are taking control of your vocal destiny by banking your voice for yourself or you are sharing the gift of voice with someone in need, our Human Voicebank recording platform will guide you through the process. 

Linda's VoiceMail Story:

Back in 2002, VocaliD's founder Professor Rupal Patel noticed two people with speech impairment communicating through their assistive technologies. One was a little girl and the other a grown man. They used different devices but the same adult voice. She knew then that something had to be done to change that. 

Several years later, Rupal and her research team were able to apply their findings on the residual melodic abilities of those with speech impairments toward the design of personalized voice blending technology. She founded VocaliD in 2014 to bring this innovation out of lab and into the hands of millions of users. 

Rupal is joined by a team of scientists, software developers, strategists, entrepreneurs, business development experts, and a cadre of volunteers, parents, and advocates who are equally committed to the vision of empowering lives through technological innovations. 



How is a VocaliD™ voice different from other commercially available computerized voices?

Only VocaliD produces custom voices. These voices are unique because they harness the recipient’s own vocalizations, which are blended with speech from a matched donor.

Is a custom voice really that important?

Speaking in one’s own voice is not a luxury; it’s a fundamental right. A voice is more than a physical signal; it is a reflection of who you are, your habits, your cultural heritage, whether you use your natural speaking voice or you rely on assistive technology.

My child uses an assistive communication device/app. How can I get her a personalized VocaliD voice and when will she have it?

Pre-order a VocaliD™ voice through this campaign at a significant discount. Pre-orders will be filled on a first-ordered, first-received basis beginning late 2016. Pre-ordering shows that there is demand for VocaliD™ voices, which we need to demonstrate in order to attract investors without whom we will be unable to bring this innovation to market. 

If you need more time to decide but are still interested, show your support by signing up on our website. Please note that pre-orders will be filled prior to contacting those on the waitlist.  

My family's ability to pay for a voice is limited. How can we get our loved one a VocaliD™ voice?

Our goal to create a product that is accessible to all regardless of their financial means.

While prosthetic voices are not covered by insurance, many of our pre-order clients have used crowdfunding approaches, which serve to both bring communities together in support of an individual and raise awareness, and also to raise the funds necessary to build a custom VocaliD voice. One platform that many have used is Indiegogo Life. 
 

I have been told by my doctor that I have a condition in which I am or will lose my voice. Can VocaliD help me?

Absolutely. You can bank your voice through the Human Voicebank web platform. We will use these recordings to build you your own computerized voice so that you can continue to be heard through your own voice.

Because this is a more straightforward process than voice blending, we can deliver your voice to you before VocaliD™ voices become widely available. And you can take back control of your vocal destiny by banking your voice today.

What is the Human Voicebank Initiative?

To minimize the cost and fulfill our commitment to making VocaliD voices available to all who need and want it, we rely on speech donations to the Human Voicebank to create uniquely blended custom voices. In just a few months, over 8,000 people --children and adults, male and female, from widely varying geographies and ethnicities -- have donated their speech. And thousands more have pledged their commitment to share the gift of voice.

Who can donate speech to VocaliD's Human Voicebank?

Our recipients are of all ages, sizes and cultural and linguistic backgrounds, so we need donors to reflect this same diversity. English speakers of any age or gender can participate. Accents are welcome and needed. We aim to capture the full texture and variety of the human voice. So if you can speak, you can contribute. Add your voice to the rich and complex tapestry of voices that we are weaving.

How are donor recordings used?

Each donation is matched with a recipient based on age, gender, language, and cultural background and voice characteristics. The donated voice is then blended with a recipient’s vocalizations to create a unique vocal persona. Donor voices are always blended unless they are for the donor themselves.

How can I donate my speech?

Login to our virtual recording studio to begin banking your voice. You will need a high-quality headset microphone, a quiet room and a computer running Google Chrome. You can also participate in a school or organization’s Voice Drive. Either way, you’ll spend about four or five hours (broken up into 20 minute or half-hour sessions) speaking a series of sentences that together capture all of the spoken sounds needed to build a computerized voice.


Which assistive technology devices are compatible with VocaliD™ voices?

Whether you use an existing AAC device or consumer application, VocaliD™ voices will be available on all platforms -- including Windows, iOS and android. We have established relationships with a number of the assistive communication device manufacturers (e.g. Tobii/Dynavox, Prentke-Romich Corporation, Lingraphica, etc) and are continuing to forge others. We are also developing our own "type and talk in your own voice" application for those who do not have an existing AAC system. If you have further questions please contact us at orders@vocaliD.co.

What does the VocaliD subscription fee cover, and how much does it cost?

The VocaliD subscription fee provides updates and improvements to meet your needs and to keep pace with technology improvements. The subscription is always free for the first six months, then renews each year on the recipient's birthday. The cost is approximately $240 per year, allowing for some variation depending on the assistive technology device with which it’s used.

Are VocaliD Voices offered in other languages?

No, not at this time. We are first focusing on English voices but hope to expand to other languages in the future. Since our donors are from all corners of the world, however, our English voices do capture the range of accents worldwide.

What part do Trailblazers play and why are Trailblazer voices more expensive than other pre-order voices?

NOTE: TRAILBLAZER VOICES ARE SOLD OUT. The Trailblazer program is the culmination of our research and development, aimed at refining our voice creation process and integrating it with existing assistive technologies. More resources, more time, and more individual attention are assigned to these recipients, making this first set of voices far more expensive to produce than the other pre-orders. The seven Trailblazers will receive their custom VocaliD™ voices by December 2015 -- up to a full year earlier than the other pre-order voices.  

I get it -- personalized computer voices can profoundly change lives. How can I help make sure that this product successfully comes to market by the end of 2016?

  • Give to the Indiegogo campaign in whatever amount works for you -- every contribution counts.
  • If you or someone you know can benefit from a VocaliD™ voice, please consider purchasing a voice in this pre-sell campaign. Not only will your contribution help bring this innovation to market sooner, it will also help us attract additional funding from government and private sources so we can continue to offer VocaliD voices to all those who need them.
  • Donate your speech to the Human VoiceBank Initiative -- either on your own or through a local Voice Drive.
  • Become a VocaliD Ambassador -- share our story, talk to family, friends, and colleagues, and use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Visit our website at www.vocalid.co and click on the “Get Involved” tab to learn about additional ways to help.

Is VocaliD Inc. hiring?

Crafting custom voices is a complex, interdisciplinary process. We need developers with expertise in big data, speech synthesis, machine learning, natural language processing; scientists and engineers with expertise in speech science, linguists, signal processing; interface and game designers; as well as those with experience in communications, business development and marketing. We are always on the lookout for talented people to join our team. If you think your background and aspirations are aligned with ours, drop us a message at jobs@vocaliD.co

If I have questions, how can I reach your team?

Please read through the FAQ first to find your answer. We have a lot of special requests, and are responding as fast as possible!

For questions relating to the Indiegogo campaign, you can contact support@indiegogo.com.

For trouble with your order, or if you would like to place a large-bulk order, please contact orders@vocaliD.co

For media inquiries, please contact press@vocaliD.co

If you are interested in sharing your story and how VocaliD voices will impact your or your loved one's life, please contact story@vocaliD.co

For job inquiries, please contact jobs@vocaliD.co

Otherwise, you can always reach us at hello@vocaliD.co
story_txt:
50 voices were ordered during the Active Indiegogo campaign including our seven early access VocaliD Trailblazers. 


We're making another 50 voices available for pre-order now, during the InDemand phase of the campaign.

Each one of us has a unique voiceprint. Yet, until now, millions of people who rely on computerized speech to communicate have been given uniform voices. Voices that don’t fit their bodies or their personalities. We wouldn’t dream of fitting a little girl with the prosthetic limb of a grown man, so, why then the same prosthetic voice?Tens of millions worldwide rely on a limited set of generic, synthetic voices. Their vocal ability may have been limited due to autism, cerebral palsy, genetic conditions, stroke, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis (ALS), brain injury, or head and/or neck cancer. Whatever the cause, they share the desire to work, play, learn, and build relationships speaking as themselves, through their own voice.Thanks to our successful IndieGoGo campaign we will be creating 7 Trailblazer voices in 2015.  Your contributions while In Demand bring VocaliD™ voices to market by late 2016.






























Through years of research we observed that even those who have severe speech impairment produce distinctive sounds when they laugh, cry, and vocalize emotions and intentions. Their vocalizations contain the voice’s source -- its pitch, tone, rhythm, and loudness. What these individuals lack is the ability to manipulate their tongue, lips, and the shape of their mouth -- their vocal filter. The filter is essential to producing clearly articulated speech. So we developed technology to harness the source characteristics of recipients and supplement them with the vocal filters available to healthy talkers. The result is a blended voice that is as understandable as the donor while conveying the vocal identity of the recipient.












In other words, even a single vowel contains enough "vocal DNA" to seed the personalization process. VocaliD's custom voices are not mere replicas of the recorded samples. They are original creations that fit and honor the recipient -- bringing attention to her words and her voice.









Every contribution moves us closer to our goal of bringing VocaliD™ voices to market by 2016. We'll thank you with a great perk!

























Listen to the stories of our beta users. Hear them speak -- through their own voices -- about the difference that VocaliD technology makes in their lives.  



It is not only recipients who feel the impact of a VocaliD™ voice. Family, friends, teachers, colleagues, and caregivers all benefit: 

a special education teacher can now differentiate among her students -- not only by their words but also through their voices;

parents delight in hearing their child speak for the first time in a voice they recognize as their child’s own; 
a teenager is empowered to build friendships and engage independently when friends, teachers, and coaches hear her as herself; 
a job candidate speaking through his own voice connects more easily with a potential employer, helping defy the odds for unemployment among those with disabilities.







VocaliD's technology can also be used to preserve and reconstruct a voice when needed. Think of it as insurance against a day when a voice is lost or unavailable for whatever reason. Perhaps a teacher suffering from throat cancer, a lawyer who is losing his voice to ALS, or even a young father, deployed overseas, who would love to read his two year old his newest bedtime story in his own voice.
Whether you are taking control of your vocal destiny by banking your voice for yourself or you are sharing the gift of voice with someone in need, our Human Voicebank recording platform will guide you through the process. 




Linda's VoiceMail Story:








Back in 2002, VocaliD's founder Professor Rupal Patel noticed two people with speech impairment communicating through their assistive technologies. One was a little girl and the other a grown man. They used different devices but the same adult voice. She knew then that something had to be done to change that. 
Several years later, Rupal and her research team were able to apply their findings on the residual melodic abilities of those with speech impairments toward the design of personalized voice blending technology. She founded VocaliD in 2014 to bring this innovation out of lab and into the hands of millions of users. 
Rupal is joined by a team of scientists, software developers, strategists, entrepreneurs, business development experts, and a cadre of volunteers, parents, and advocates who are equally committed to the vision of empowering lives through technological innovations.

Only VocaliD produces custom voices. These voices are unique because they harness the recipient’s own vocalizations, which are blended with speech from a matched donor.

For those selecting the pre-order perks, including the option to move toward the front of the line, here is a peek at the inventory we have on order (due to arrive mid-late June).  Note that the pictures illustrate the wetsuits in their unfinished state...all wetsuits will be embellished with paint and fabrics per the customer's request.

story:
Our Story

Hello! We're Eduardo Burgueno and Benjamin Jensen, inventors of Disc-Traction. We both suffer from back pain, but couldn’t seem to find any convenient solution that would help. Current traction devices didn’t help to alleviate our back pain, so we decided to take matters into our own hands. We invented Disc-Traction as a more effective way to relieve back pain.

Our design offers an improved alternative to static traction devices because it enables the user to control the level of force. It features a therapeutic exercise belt with two nylon handles that can be pressed to decompress and relieve pressure on the spine. For convenient back pain relief, simply secure the Disc-Traction belt around the waist and press down on the handles while performing the included isometric exercises. Your pledges and donations will help to fund inventory production costs as well as publicity and marketing efforts for the ultimate back pain reliever - Disc-Traction!

Our Goal: To help relieve lumbar back pain and sciatica 

Back pain is one of the most prevalent problems affecting adults. But just how wide-spread is it? Let's take a look at some statistics provided by the American Chiropractic Association:

  • Low back pain is the single leading cause of disability worldwide.
  • Experts estimate that as many as 80% of the population will experience back problems at some point in their lives.
  • Back pain is one of the most common reasons for missed work and the second most common reason for visits to the doctor's office.
  • Americans spend at least $50 billion each year on back pain.

Through disc decompression, Disc-Traction can help to relieve lumbar back
pain and sciatica. As you can see, back pain is a prevalent and costly problem.
Disc-Traction is a low-cost preventative measure that is simple, convenient,
and inexpensive. 

How It Works:

A velcro strap allows you to quickly and comfortably secure Disc-Traction to fit
your size.

By pushing down on the handles, Disc-Traction relieves lumbar back pain and sciatica through disc decompression.

Durable materials with double stitching make this belt high-quality and long-lasting.

Performing the recommended isometric exercises strengthens and rehabilitates the muscles and joints, as well as encourages correct posture and alignment.

Exercises facilitate muscle relaxation and blood circulation.

Disc-Traction can be used standing, sitting, or laying down.

You can perform the exercises daily or on an as-needed basis. Applying this type of force while standing, walking, and/or exercising is really what sets the
Disc-Traction Belt apart from all other decompression devices.

A simple design allows you to focus on what matters most – back pain relief.

The Disc-Traction material is thin and can fold or roll for optimal portability so you can take it on-the-go. Don't get caught without it!

Testimonials:

Read what Disc-Traction users have to say about our product.

“As a physical therapist specializing in the care of the spine for the past 31 years, I find the Disc-Traction belt to be an essential tool in my kit. It is especially helpful in the care of older or elderly patients who can’t tolerate pain at the knee or hip joints. I have a couple of the most popular sizes in stock so I have them at the ready.” –Ellen, Physical Therapist, Wausau, WI

“The very first time I saw Disc-Traction Therapeutic Exercise Belt, I realized the potential use in the treatment of my patients with low back problems. I believe the belt can be an essential tool for people needing help in relieving pain and discomfort.” -Douglas Hibbard, D.C. 

“Disc-Traction belt has been very helpful in relieving my back pain suffered as a result of a fall. I am very grateful for the help received.” -Mina Bruce 

“I have had my Disc-Traction belt for about two months. It relieves the chronic pain in my lower back and I can walk better as I use it according to the instructions. I would recommend it to anyone with back problems.” -Ronald W. Jackson 

“The belt has really helped me with getting rid of chronic back pain I’ve suffered for many years. It is amazing this invention of yours can bring such relief. I’ve recommended this wonderful belt to many of my friends.” -Rev. Patrick Tierney

“It’s amazing how little effort it takes to gain the benefit and relief from
Disc-Traction belt. My first experience brought instant relief. Stretching with the belt for back fatigue after long distance driving really helps.” -Carmen Burditte

“I do hard work for a living and whenever I strain my back, I use the Disc-Traction belt for a few minutes a day and I feel immediate relief. I would recommend that anyone with back pain give this a try.” -Steve, Steve’s Handyman Service

"After hours working at the computer, my creaking back talks to me. I just put on my Disc-Traction belt and the pain goes away. Not only that, my posture improves.” -Susan V. Wilson

“Anything I can do to condition my back muscles and spine to avoid the very painful back problems I’ve had is a boon to me. Disc-Traction has helped me tremendously, especially when used each morning. Disc-Traction works!” -Dick Vara

“Disc-Traction belt has saved my life. I can walk without pain and even ride the bus.” -Blanca Cambre

Parting Words:

Eduardo here - Ben and I are very passionate in our work. We use Disc-Traction every day, and so do our close friends and family. After trying so many products that promised to fix our back pain, we knew it was time to take matters into our own hands. Disc-Traction works. Disc-Traction has improved our lives and has kept us nearly pain free for years. We want to spread the love to all of you, and we hope you'll share Disc-Traction with those you care about. So please, donate to our campaign. Your donations will help us to create more inventory and reach more people around the world. Hopefully you can buy a belt for yourself. If you can't, that's okay; support us in any way you can, whether it be $1 or a Facebook share. If you can donate a little more and you choose to get a Disc-Traction belt for your whole family, know that our family is so excited to help you start this journey.

Disc-Traction has improved our lives and has kept us nearly pain free for years. We want to spread the love to all of you, and we hope you'll share Disc-Traction with those you care about. So please, donate to our campaign. Your donations will help us to create more inventory and reach more people around the world. Hopefully you can buy a belt for yourself. If you can't, that's okay; support us in any way you can, whether it be $1 or a Facebook share. If you can donate a little more and you choose to get a Disc-Traction belt for your whole family, know that our family is so excited to help you start this journey.

story:
Hi there.

Molly Miller creates eco-friendly clothing for women that promotes a positive body image.

The clothing industry is flawed.  Clothing companies use advertisements to depict people enjoying the aspirational carefree lifestyle on the beach with friends—but their clothes hurt the environment and the airbrushed images don’t support a positive body image.

Here at Molly Miller, we don’t think you should have to choose between fun with friends on the beach and doing good.  We believe you can have both. 

It’s why we use sustainable fabrics.  It’s why we produce our clothing in socially-responsible factories in the United States.  It’s why we donate 7% of profits to organizations that promote healthy body images. 

We’re not setting out to create just another clothing company.  We’re setting out to create a movement for change and we’d love for you to join. 

  Welcome and thank you for your support,
       Danielle Dalton and Willa Gustavson
               The Molly Miller Team


To begin the Molly Miller line, we’re starting with one piece of clothing—a quarter-zip pullover sweater for women.  We took the classic quarter-zip pullover sweater and put our own Molly Miller twist on it. 

This is a rendering of the pullover, which is currently being constructed.  We hope to provide a picture of the physical pullover by the end of next week. 

We’ll ask the questions we know you’re thinking, “Why launch this campaign now and not wait a week?  Isn’t this jumping a little too fast?”

Great question.  We see creating this pullover and the entire Molly Miller movement as a journey.  We want to invite others to join us and take part in the experience.  We felt that waiting until every last detail was perfected would make this Indiegogo campaign a glorified pre-ordering process. 

In return for your trust, we promise regular updates and integrity.  Reach out with questions, we love to chat about Molly Miller. 


This $4,000 campaign will go towards funding the first run of production of our first product, a quarter-zip pullover sweater.  It will support purchasing materials (fabric, zippers, clothing tags) and the physical production of the garment. 

As a token of our appreciation for your support, we’d like to offer the Indiegogo community the first opportunity to purchase the Prep Pullover by offering it as one of our rewards. 




1.  Join the Molly Miller community!  Feel free to reach out on Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram.  Or join our email list at http://www.mollymillerusa.com.  

2.  Support the campaign.  Currently, the only way to get Molly Miller apparel and accessories, including our Prep Pullover, is to participate in our Indiegogo campaign.  We’re all about building community, so we’re excited to offer our products to another great community—the folks at Indiegogo. 

3.  Share.  Tell your friends about Molly Miller and how they can get involved…Think about it.  Wouldn’t you rather share the news about Molly Miller now than have to share your quarter-zip pullover with your friend later?  Share now, so you can both get one!

Welcome to the Molly Miller community.  Thank you for your support and we look forward to getting to know you.

Cheers & Thank you very much,
Danielle & Willa
The Molly Miller Team


P.S. Wondering who Molly Miller is?  Molly Miller is a type of fish.  Our friends, Sam & Marina, thought the name would be great for the company late one night when trying out different names.  We wouldn't be where we are today without the help of all our friends and words can't do justice to how thankful we are to them and you for your support.

story:
Vibrant Eye Clothing. Amazing, vibrant and unique.


I have the best sublimation products out of anyone else on the current market. My products are of the highest quality, they don't have any white lines or smears, they're moisture wicking, and they feel soft and comfortable. 

Plus, they cost less. 

I'm doing this Indiegogo campaign to help raise money so I can order shirts, tank tops, and finally women's shirts and hoodies. 

(For Hoodies and Women's shirts also!! All designs are double sided)

ASTRO:

CHIEF:

COSMONAUT:

DRAGON:

GLASS:

JUNGLE:

NAUTILUS:

PANDORA:


Examples of the women's shirt:

Examples of the hoodie:

To see examples of our shirts and tank tops, check out our website: www.vibranteyeclothing.com
CLICK HERE FOR HIGH RESOLUTION PHOTOS


Did I Mention They Look Amazing Under Blacklight Also?


Past Customer Reviews:

"I own both [nautilus] and the tesla. I've owned them for a while now. they are truly top quality shirts. they have not faded after going through the wash multiple times. the colors have remained vibrant. they look absolutely stunning in person. I get told by people they love my shirt. Young kids seem to be mystified by them."

"This shirt is SOOOO COMFORTABLE!!!! I’ve washed it and it doesn't shrink or lose its color. Very true to size."

"I hesitated for a while to buy this shirt. I've had it for a bit now and as the rest have said, it really is a top quality shirt. I highly recommend. Keep up the great work"

"The quality of material is AMAZING! Shirt is better than expected, and I have already had one stolen from my fiancé! Everyone comments on these awesome shirts!!


WHEN YOU BACK A PERK YOU WILL BE CONTACTED VIA EMAIL ASKING ABOUT WHAT SIZE/DESIGN YOU'D LIKE. 

International Shipping (outside USA) is $15 total


Risks and challenges:

I've been designing and selling sublimation shirts for about year now and have hundreds of happy customers around the world. If there has ever been an issue with an order I've done everything I can to work thing out. I have a great relationship with my manufacturer and they have always been reliable. With doing business there are always risks and challenges, but I will do everything I can to keep my customers happy.
