through our ongoing operation:                                                                       ONE
YEAR, ONE CAUSEThis year, our aid will go to CARE ALBINO CHILDREN, a small Ivorian
association wich defends the rights of poor albinos children and helps them by
providing, among other, products and accessories for their skin protection,
school accessories.For every purchase of an outfit ( and also here on Indiegogo),Atiklaman
will make a donation of $ 3  to  CARE ALBINO CHILDREN               Who? The story of AtiklamanI’m
Api, I am 33 living in a charming city in the Center of France, founder of
Atiklaman lingerie.                                                  Two
years ago,this idea came up,I loved  lingerie and I wanted
to make  it differently. I
thought:  having a double western and African culture ,Why not take avail on that and get the most out of it? I  dreamed of lingerie which would allow the world to discover the
African richness with its amazing conceptions: Bubu, tam-tam, bones in the nose , etc.           Then,i was financially down,i nearly had 60 $. bearing in mind that i had no knowIedge whatsoever when it comes to sowing clothes but i was determined,  I realized my first hand made prototypes  with a thread and a needle.did
not know how people would   welcome this new strange and unknown style.
But I was delighted  because people loved. It was incredible. They
all embraced these warm colors. 
Quickly, I enrolled for  special sewing  lingerie class in order to sew the sets  and supply  customers. It was not easy, but
I was so passionate and excited that all challenges coming my way were just showers of opportunities and knowledge as they help me documenting my lessons learnt.Then, I worked with a little Parisian workshop to produce 200 models of the first lingerie collection.The
women felt comfortable, beautiful and sexy in Atiklaman . It was the first satisfaction.
The small collection of 8 models was very well welcomed.Prices are between 60 and 90$ depending on the model.Just to say that the request really exists and there is a clientele for this type of product.
Today, The
Fan page had almost 2000 fans without any advertising (You
know, it is really not easy to sew and advertise at the same time :-)Atiklaman receives regularly supports and requests from all around the
world: North America, Africa, Europe.
I am truly grateful to all those who believed in this project.
  the passion to magnify women
Atiklaman at work . Below, our last  photo shoot  in April with one of our favorite Model , Janet  expecting a baby and our favorite Make up ArtistCrystal .                                                   Before the shooting, make up time                                                                           The result                                                Why Atiklaman is on Indiegogo?                Today, I wish to give a new run-up to this dream started
one year ago by switching to the superior speed. Promote Atiklaman all over the world and be able to dress all the women of all races and all sizes, so that they can
have a feel of African's wealth.
The
purpose is to improve the quality of products by working with professionals and
produce in industrial quantity in order to meet customer demand, improve  the brand value and also attend to national and international events.
An unusual project as Atiklaman is too risky for
banks and the necessary amount is very too weak to interest businesses-Angel. that is why I turned to people who really believe in this project.
You, yes YOU can
participate in this great challenge and help  make this dream me true.
Contribute to the success of this project. t is said that a 1000 miles journey starts with a baby's step, but it is
with your help that things can be materialize for good. I need you. Atiklaman
needs you to definitely take off. 
Alone, I can   only make 10 sets per week.With your help, Atiklaman can produces 500 once  and
more and focus on what we do best: Making beautiful designs to beautify
women.                                            The use of fund raisedThe objective is
to develop and manufacture a first swimsuits collection  for the summer to come , prepare
the next collection of lingerie and conduct marketing activities.
 Concretely with $ 20,000 we will: 
-Hire a design
office to  set up the technical documentation prototypes models swimsuits
and lingerie for his next collection,  The lingerie models  will include several sizes from cup A to G. because at the moment  Atiklaman
provides only 3 cups (B, C, few D) and hope that all women of all sizes can wear
Atiklaman products.The swimwear collection of this summer will include 10 models too, size S to XXL.With: 3 Monokinis -1 trikini- 3 bikinis high waisted -3 Bikinis low waisted.
- Produce
lingerie and swimwear in a factory in larger quantities to respond to the
request.
-to get access
to advertising and marketing to promote Atiklaman : Shows, photos, press
releases, samples,etc.                                       What do you earn by supporting                                 Atiklaman?                     For all those who decide to trust and  support
Atiklaman,  get unique features.
 First, lot of gratitude, the  satisfaction and pride of having contributed to the success of a business and a dream .By engaging in financing Atiklaman you participate in the success of a company with real values ​​while registering in a sustainable development approach .then you get uniques perks:  Atiklaman
products  at preferential prices for yourself, your friend, family  (it could be a fine gift) or your shop and enjoy advantage of beautiful and original swimsuits   that you will find nowhere else. You will look stunning on the beach this summer!All the contributors will be personally named
on the fanpage and the website .Take a look, it's worth it.You can check here to find your size for swimsuits and bra sets           And now, the ball is your court                    Here we are, you know everything. Thank you for having granted  a few minutes
of your invaluable time to listen to and read this  project .
 I know that the Indiegogo
community is a great community and I rely on you to take up the challenge.
Remember that unity is strength. Alone , I can’t do it. Today, You have the power
to make the dream Atiklaman become reality. If the Atiklaman project convinced
you, just do it.       If you like Atiklaman, share us! Even
if you believe that you cannot help in anything,  you can also do something by sharing this project in your circle of friends and in all your
social networks. It would be of a great help.You can use the link provided below the video at the top of the page to invite more people to joins us and also share this tips below.                         So, be
part on it and have a nice day. A très bientôt

story:
Our Story

It all started when I saw an online discussion involving a few people who wanted to make stickers to replace Fruitvale BART station with "Oscar Grant" on BART system maps. I thought to myself, what if we could replace every BART station name with Bay Area icons of social justice? Why shouldn't we live in a world where we can take a ten car train to Angela Davis International Airport, or to Ohlone cities like Huchian or Ramaytush? How would this altered geography change our perception of what is truly important?

The Decolonized Area Rapid Transit (DART) design evolved out a "crowdsourced" process where the station names were discussed through Facebook comments. 40-60 people made suggestions for different local social justice heroes, some less known than others, which in itself was an educational process as commenters advocated for different communities.

The Impact

Whoever owns one of these DART t-shirts will be a proud, walking map of the "other Bay Area" – where we don't honor conquistadors, missionaries, big money developers, and colonization. Instead, we honor activists and intellectuals in labor, gay rights, racial justice, civil rights, indigenous self-determination, women's rights, queer rights, disability rights, and more. We also recognize that we live on and benefit from occupied indigenous lands by emphasizing Ohlone names for local places.

The finished DART map is a wonderful educational tool that will have people asking questions and educating themselves about names and causes they may not be familiar with. With so many Bay Area social justice icons and heroes to be proud of, it's the perfect discussion starter and an awesome way to rep your home.

What We Need & What You Get

I'm committed to having these tshirts silkscreened by local artists. Why? On-demand printing websites commonly use heat transfer printing, which usually results in lower-quality, blocky prints. By silkscreening, the result is more pleasing to the eye and sense of touch.

On-demand printing also send our money out to a faceless national corporation, whereas silkscreening locally keeps money in the community and supports local artists. It's my way of keeping resources circulating locally.

Silkscreening is a process where each color in the design needs to be separated and printed. The DART design contains six colors - black, red, orange, yellow, green, and blue. The overall cost breaks down like this:

Film output: $5 per color x 6 = $30

Screens: $25 per color x 6 = $150

Pantone color match: $10 per color x 6 = $60

Six color tshirt printing: $2.78 per tshirt x total quantity 72 = $221.76

PRINTING TOTAL: $461.76 + 8.75% tax = $502.16


If we don't reach the entire goal, the money raised will still be used to print tshirts, though it will be an appropriately reduced quantity.

When finished, these tshirts will be offered for sale in a select number of locally-owned Bay Area shops. A certain percentage (to be determined) of the income from sales will be donated to local causes.

Remember, if you donate a certain amount of money now towards the printing, you automatically reserve a shirt for yourself!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by getting the word out on Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, and anywhere else you can reach friends, comrades, and colleagues who are proud to live in or be from the Bay Area. Any donation helps, no matter how small.

story:
Les Autres Étoiles • The Other Stars

Hello everyone, I'm Zii (Chun-Zi) - I'm the creator behind the concept for my shoppe, Les Autres Étoiles. This concept has been in the works for a year now and I'm finally ready to get started on making this a huge part of my life. I spend a good portion of every week sewing to my hearts content, but it's always projects for other occassions. I'd now like to move forward with Les Autres Étoiles and present to you my own interpretation of fashion. 

I aspire to inspire and to bring my creations to life in the very large (and always growing) fashion industry. To be an entrepreneur is a very difficult lifestyle choice to make. It requires a lot of time, effort, energy and money to get started, and even more of the aforementioned to keep yourself stable once your business takes off. I've never been more sure of a decision in my life. This is who I am, this is how I want to live, this is what I want to do. Through funding my campaign, you're becoming a very huge part of my long sought-after dream and for that I am forever in your debt. 

Concept

My clothing will reflect a combination of French romance and elegance, with Japanese-inspired playfulness (bright colours, interesting combinations of fabrics not normally used together, etc.) all wrapped into a couture designing style. These designs will be structured yet fluid. They’re designed for the alternative person who can feel appropriate in all occasions both formal and casual without having to adjust their outfit. You will certainly be noticed when you enter a room in this collection as I am combining a lot of very opposite elements to create a perfect harmony in garment design.

Every garment I make will speak for itself. I plan to make a range of garments from skirts and dresses to sweaters, shrugs, boleros and even gloves and wrist warmers! I'd like to bring an entire line to life with my official shop launch.

Donations

When you make a donation to this campaign, I'd like you to be fully aware of what you're contributing towards. Not only are you making my dreams a reality, but you're buying the supplies I need to make that happen. The following is a list of items and materials I plan to purchase with this money:

  • Dress Forms - One in each size range, to ensure a perfect fit of all items before they're sent out.
  • A Cutting/Rotary Mat - For precision cutting that isn't nearly as time consuming as scissors can be!
  • A Cutting Table - One that can fold away when not in use as my work space is extremely limited, and cutting out patterns on my kitchen floor is not ideal.
  • Wacom Bamboo Create Tablet - So that I can professionally transfer my designs from paper to my computer, and create CUSTOM fabrics to be used only for Les Autres Étoiles. 
  • Custom Printed Fabrics (which range from $16/m to $38/m)
  • Custom Sew-In Tags - So that every garment is marked with a logo and a size, plus washing instructions!
  • Specialty Fabrics from a near-by city (Toronto, Ontario) that has a much larger selection than my current location.
  • Travel to and from said destination.
  • Notions & Tidbits - This includes all zippers, thread, buttons, needles, pressing hams, a new iron, trims, yarn, elastic, ribbon, lace, storage containers, et cetera. 

Please remember, every donation counts! Small donations can add up quickly and have a huge impact on a fundraising goal. I truly appreciate every cent received, and I will make extremely good use of all of the funds I raise. 

If you can't afford to contribute, I do understand. Another way you can help is by sharing my campaign with your friends and promoting my campaign on your own facebook pages.

Thank You!

Thank you all so much for taking the time to read about my goal with Les Autres Étoiles and for all of your contributions! To reach this goal will change my entire life and make me feel more complete on the path I'm choosing to go down. 

Sincerely, Zii

Les Autres Étoiles on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/Les.Autres.Etoiles/

Chun-Zi on Facebook - https://www.facebook.com/ChunZi.Stardust
